learning_outcomes.description: Construct logically correct and mathematically sound proofs.

Apply concepts of logic, set theory, relations, induction, principles of counting, probability, algebraic structures and elementary number theory to mathematical problems in more advanced mathematical courses and to problems encountered in other fields of study.
Demonstrate an understanding and well-founded knowledge of the mathematics presented in this course and thus be able to apply techniques from this course to solve both familiar and novel problems
Select and use the appropriate level, style and means of written communication, using the symbolic, graphical, and diagrammatic forms relevant to the context
Understand some applications of mathematics to relevant fields, such as computer programming and logic.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description: Each assignment requires you to answer a set of questions and submit your written solutions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit this assessment item through the link in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The in-semester exam will be scheduled on a Saturday, with the exact date to be provided by UQ Examinations.

You must hold all of the following three Saturdays free until the exam date is officially announced

  • 29 March 2025 (Week 5)
  • 5 April 2025 (week 6)
  • 12 April 2025 (week 7)
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: The exam will be held during the UQ exam period; the schedule will be provided by UQ Examinations.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
3/03/2025 - 30/05/2025

Marks will be assigned during the two-hour practicals by the tutors based on discussions with students as they work on the open-ended task material.
assessments.task_description: For each practical (weeks 2-13), your tutor(s) will allocate marks based on your engagement with the material, which will be open-ended and exploratory in nature. There is no requirement to solve all of the problems, only to engage in the exploratory nature of the tasks. Your final percentage for the practical component of the course will be a combination of the weekly marks for 8 of the 12 practicals, using whichever 8 practicals give you the highest overall percentage.
assessments.submission_guidelines: There is no need to submit written material.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Pre-class videos, readings, and quizzes

To prepare for each class, you will need to watch one or two short videos, read some pages of the textbook, and complete a short quiz.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Pre-class videos, readings, and quizzes To prepare for each class, you will need to watch one or two short videos, read some pages of the textbook, and complete a short quiz.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Each week there will be three hours of lectures during which you will discuss important concepts, work through examples, and answer questions.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Each week there will be three hours of lectures during which you will discuss important concepts, work through examples, and answer questions.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(03 Mar - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Practicals

Practicals give students a chance to ask questions relating to material covered in lectures, and to engage further with the course material through guided exploration. Practicals also give students the opportunity to discuss with their peers approaches to formulating and solving mathematical problems.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
